resources.string: Shows the status of your local repository
Downloads all versioned files from the default branch, if your local one is out of date
Downloads all versioned files from a specific branch, if your local one is out of date
Adds all modified files to be committed
Adds a specific modified file to be committed
Commits all added files through a commit editor window
Commits all added files and sets the commit message
Interactively adds files to be committed
Adds and commits all modified files
Sends the latest commit(s) into a branch in the remote repository
Deletes a branch in the remote repository
Saves all modified files in the memory and restores them to their latest committed state
Reloads all modified files that have been saved at the latest stash
Shows a list with all stash IDs
Initialises a local Git repository in the current directory
Adds a remote repository with its name and url, or ssh address
Restores all modified files to their latest committed state
Restores a specific modified file to its latest committed state
Moves into a branch
Creates a new local branch
Restores the current branch to its latest committed state
Appends all the contents of the current branch onto the target branch
Interactively appends all the contents of the current branch into the target branch
Shows a log containing all commits
Creates a commit reverting the changes of a specific commit
Shows all local branches
Safely deletes a local branch
Force deletes a local branch
Shows all branches, both local and remote
Shows all branches that have been merged into the main branch
Sets a value to a specific configuration item in the .config file
Deletes all new files from your local repository
Deletes both new files and new directories from your local repository
Deletes all unversioned files and directories from your local repository
Merges a specific branch into your current branch
Shows in details all modifications done so far
Shows in details all modifications done so far in a specific file
Shows in details all modifications done so far, in comparison with a specific branch
Shows each user responsible for the changes made in a specific file
Launches the pre-defined tool for viewing modifications in the local repository
Launches the pre-defined tool for handling merge conflicts in the local repository
Launches the pre-defined tool for using Git with a graphic user interface
Downloads all data available from the remote repository
Links the local branch to a remote branch
Downloads all data available from the remote repository and shows a verbose log
Creates an alias for a command
Clones a remote repository in your local machine
Clones a remote repository into a specific directory in your local machine
Removes a command alias
Adds and commits all modified files and sets the commit message
Creates an annotated tag
Creates an annotated tag with a message
Saves the tag into the remote repository
